body:
### Problem

I was trying to set up kickstart on my schools ssh terminal and upon creating the init.lua file I get the following error

## Error Message
Error detected while processing /nfs/elsrv4/users2/grad/name/.config/nvim/init.lua:
lazy.nvim requires Neovim >= 0.8.0
E5113: Error while calling lua chunk: /nfs/elsrv4/users2/grad/name/.config/nvim/init.lua:358: module '
telescope' not found:
no field package.preload['telescope']
no file './telescope.lua'
no file '/usr/share/luajit-2.1.0-beta3/telescope.lua'
no file '/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/telescope.lua'
no file '/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/telescope/init.lua'
no file '/usr/share/lua/5.1/telescope.lua'
no file '/usr/share/lua/5.1/telescope/init.lua'
no file './telescope.so'
no file '/usr/local/lib/lua/5.1/telescope.so'
no file '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/lua/5.1/telescope.so'
no file '/usr/local/lib/lua/5.1/loadall.so'
stack traceback:
[C]: in function 'require'
/nfs/elsrv4/users2/grad/name/.config/nvim/init.lua:358: in main chunk

### Steps to reproduce

PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="22.04"
VERSION="22.04.3 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)"
VERSION_CODENAME=jammy

NVIM v0.7.2
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

git clone https://github.com/nvim-lua/kickstart.nvim.git "${XDG_CONFIG_HOME:-$HOME/.config}"/nvim

### Expected behavior

Running the command `nvim` should work and not result in an error

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.7.2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, vim 8.2.2121

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS

### Terminal name/version

OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.6, OpenSSL 3.0.2 15 Mar 2022

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

appimage
title: Linux Installation Defaults to an Old Version of NeoVim
